meanings.definition: Italics: a style of typeface in which letters are slanted to the right for emphasis or distinction.
meanings.sent1: The book title was written in *italics* to make it stand out.
meanings.sent2: Please write your name in *italics* on the form.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the keyboard and accidentally turned everything into *italics*.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was like *italics*, leaning towards elegance.
meanings.sent5: The professor emphasized the key points by underlining them in *italics*.

meanings.definition: Italics: printed in or using italics.
meanings.sent1: The document had important information highlighted in *italics*.
meanings.sent2: The title of the article was written in *italics*.
meanings.sent3: She felt fancy typing in *italics* for her presentation.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in *italics*, with colors blending beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The invitation was elegant, with the details written in *italics*.
